metadata.title: CVE-2021-2179 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Group Replication Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.33 and prior and 8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-common - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.35-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
